company.name: ReadyTech Corporation
company.business_description: ReadyTech Corporation provides online and instructor-led training services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: ReadyTech Corporation, an online and instructor-led training company, published privacy policy statements on its website claiming it was actively in the process of certifying compliance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. Although ReadyTech initiated a Privacy Shield application with the U.S. Department of Commerce in October 2016, it never completed the steps necessary to actually participate in the framework. Despite this, its website continued to represent that it was certifying compliance and even committed to Privacy Shield-related dispute resolution procedures. The FTC alleged these statements were deceptive under Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be actively in the process of certifying compliance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and directed consumers to view its certification on the Privacy Shield website
representations_made.quoted_text: ReadyTech is in the process of certifying that we comply with the U.S. – E.U. Privacy Shield framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal data from European Union member countries. To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view ReadyTech’s certification, please visit https://www.privacyshield.gov/welcome.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be in compliance with the US-EU Privacy Shield and committed to resolving privacy complaints under that framework
representations_made.quoted_text: In compliance with the US-EU Privacy Shield, ReadyTech commits to resolve complaints about your privacy and our collection or use of your Personal Information. European Union citizens with inquiries or complaints regarding this privacy policy should first contact ReadyTech at get-info @ readytech.com.

representations_made.description: Claimed to have committed to refer unresolved Privacy Shield complaints to JAMS as an independent dispute resolution mechanism
representations_made.quoted_text: ReadyTech has further committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints under the US-EU Privacy Shield to an independent dispute resolution mechanism, JAMS. If you do not receive timely acknowledgment of your complaint, or if your complaint is not satisfactorily addressed by ReadyTech, please visit the JAMS web site at https://www.jamsadr.com/about/submit-a-case for more information and to file a complaint.

counts.title: Privacy Shield Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represents, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it is actively in the process of certifying compliance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.
counts.fact: Respondent is not actively in the process of certifying compliance with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. Although it initiated an application to Commerce in October 2016, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 11 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: ReadyTech Corporation, a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, its membership in, compliance with, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in any privacy or security program, including but not limited to EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss- U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business successors, and collect signed acknowledgments from all recipients.

requirements.description: Within 10 days after the effective date, Respondent must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 20 years after the issuance date, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers/members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to the Order, agents and representatives, and any successor business entities; delivery must occur within 10 days after the effective date for current personnel, and before assuming responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the 2 subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: From each individual or entity that received a copy of the Order, Respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit sworn notices within 14 days of changes to contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings, following specific submission format and delivery requirements.

requirements.description: Within 60 days after the issuance date, submit a sworn compliance report identifying contact information, all businesses, activities, compliance status for each provision, and copies of Order acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change to a designated point of contact or to Respondent's corporate structure (including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any entity subject to this Order)
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of any bankruptcy, insolvency, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within 14 days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: Any sworn submission must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, including the prescribed declaration language, date, full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the FTC's Associate Director of Enforcement, with subject line beginning 'In re ReadyTech Corporation, FTC File No. 1823100'
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re ReadyTech Corporation, FTC File No. 1823100.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specific categories of records for 20 years after the Order's issuance date and retain each record for at least 5 years, covering financial, personnel, compliance, and advertising materials.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold
requirements.quoted_text: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services, including name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination if applicable
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making such representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of a written request from the Commission, Respondent must submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury) and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Respondent must permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview any affiliated individual who has agreed to an interview; the interviewee may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals, without identification or prior notice; nothing in this Order limits the Commission's use of compulsory process under FTC Act Sections 9 and 20
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on October 17, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specific exceptions for shorter provisions, non-named respondents, and dismissed complaints.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on the Commission's website as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: Order terminates on October 17, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any Order violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later; exceptions apply for provisions with shorter terms, non-named respondents, and orders already terminated
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on October 17, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

requirements.description: If a complaint is dismissed or a court rules Respondent did not violate the Order and that ruling is final, the Order terminates as if the complaint had never been filed, except it will not terminate during the pending appeal period
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on October 17, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
